Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Hotel room and services were very good. Food was a bit pricey. It is not convenient for an "airport hotel" -- shuttle runs only once an hour and it is a 15 minute drive to the airport. Area recommendations Latin quarter - variety of restaurants and night life. Old Montreal for historic sites and lake front activities

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Slender1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The hotel seemed brand new and the room a real delight. Very nouveau funky looking place. Beds were outstandingly comfortable with a very comfortable pillow and duvet cover. The room had a large bathroom; safe; fridge; closet; free-wifi; coffee maker; disposible cups and coffee cups. Very friendly front check-in staff. Only negative is the cost in the restaurant. For two adults and one kid we paid over $40.00 for bacon and eggs and two teas...nothing more. It was very pricey and the food was mediocre. We planned to leave our car at the hotel prior to departure, but could not find the hotel - it is a bit out of the way; ended up parking at the airport anyway. Had to call the hotel for clear directions from the aiport parking lot before attempting to find it again. It was no more than 10 minutes with the right directions. Two thumbs up for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's much better than just an airport hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SamprasCanada
Reviews.Content: Novotel Montreal Airport is a very nice and very cozy the moment you step into the lobby. It's a very modern and of course it has a European feel. The price is right even when you book it on the hotel's website. It was a little less than a hundred dollar per night for a king bed room. You get free WIFI, a nice roomy shower, and quite a spacious room. The design of the room is modern and doesn't have a weird odor. In general, this is a very pleasant hotel and I will definitely go back. The staff in the front desk and the waiters in the restaurant are helpful and easy to deal with. The few things which it can work on are the price of the breakfast buffet which is a bit much. For that reason, it's better to order the Ã  la carte menu. Also, the water of the pool is way too cold. The whirlpool is fine but really the temperature of the pool can be raised a little bit. Another thing, this hotel is not exactly right next to the airport. It's about ten to fifteen minutes to the airport, depends how fast you drive. Yes, it's a little out of the way but the good thing is that you get to enjoy the tranquility without having an airport right next to you. If you are going downtown, it's about fifteen to twenty minutes with no traffic. Nowadays with the traffic in Montreal, I would suggest you park your car near a subway station and take the subway to downtown. It's much more easier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: chutaiko
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are generous and new, the staff is friendly and helpful. The only two drawbacks are 1. The Brekafast buffet is outrageously priced (which is usual for chain hotels) 2. It's in the middle of nowhere unless you work near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. Very modern very comfortable bed. The indoor swimming pool could have been warmer but was still ok. Nice hot hot tub. The bathroom doors in the hotel room are nice and modern but don't allow for much privacy. The door faces the bed and are not sound proof - could be uncomfortable for some.

Reviews.Title: “No major complaint”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not our first stay, because location fits well near family in Montreal, or when we get there to take a plane. Relatively quite clean, as usual, but muddy footsteps in the elevators, because of the weather during that stay. Moisturising lotion in the bathrooms would be most appreciated, especially in the winter season. They used to have some, if I remember well my first stay, a few years ago. They offer free shuttle service to the airport, which is nice since it saves you the cab fare, but it is not available past 22h00.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMHBJH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2nights as part of a meeting. Inconveniently located at the far side of the airport. Good and free shuttle service, however, if taking a taxi be sure to clarify tha you are going to Novotel Aeroport or you fouls end up at the downtown Novotel. Nice lobby, bar and dining area. Good service. Good place for a meeting if need being near the airport. Good workout area, pool and hot tub. Restaurants nearby but can not easily walk to so taxi necessary?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but room decor needed updating.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stopped here overnight on a long 2-day drive. Convenient because of its location right off highway 40, and because the hotel restaurant is decent and stays open late (and has room service too). All the public areas are clean and attractive, and our upgraded room had a very nice, upscale bathroom. But the bedroom decor was in need of updating: grungy carpet and a single, tired-looking chair with worn-out upholstery. We considered ordering room service, but there would've been nowhere to eat it in this large but strangely barren room. (There would be plenty of space for a small dining table with 2 chairs.) Overall, an adequate 'highway motel' room to stay for the night, with a good restaurant as a bonus... but with a 'downtown' price, the room is not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but.....”
Reviews.Author: chanty777
Reviews.Content: for a new property, I would expect that the rooms would be in perfect shape. The carpet is starting to lift and can easily be tripped on. The bathroom doors do not make bathroom time very private. There were no handles on the inside of the bathroom doors to close them. There should be a night light in the washroom. Other than that the room and stay was excellent. The beds were the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept on. The buffet breakfast in the morning was perfect for me and my family. We especially loved the french crepes.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tedibearboo
Reviews.Content: If you know your way around and have a vehicle, this place is ideal. Well centred between the West Island, Laval, the South Shore and downtown, you can get pretty much anywhere in short order. We ate in the dining room twice and found staff to be friendly and polite. Menu prices were very reasonable as Hotel Restaurant prices go, and the food was delicious and served hot. The Front Desk staff were excellent, the room was very clean, large, and comfortably appointed. We travel extensively worldwide so we have plenty of places to compare to. It is located in an area of Head Offices (not what I would call Industrial), so you are not within walking distance of stores, buts it's incredibly quiet, providing easy access to the main highways. Free in-room Wifi proved very reliable, ample free outdoor parking - an all around great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MaggieM94
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using Accor reward points. It is a newer property, and the location worked for us, but I would not recommend if you are travelling for leisure and want to be near Old Montreal. Overall I have no complaints, but I would not consider this hotel worth the $$ I would have paid had I not been able to utilize the reward certificates.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Novotel Montreal Aeroport!”
Reviews.Author: thevacationlovers
Reviews.Content: Despite spending most of our weekend in downtown Montreal, we loved staying at this hotel. We drove in from Toronto, dropped off our luggage, had a lovely drink at the small but cozy hotel bar and dashed off to enjoy the city. We were offered a great price at the hotel and benefited further with free parking each night. The hotel lobby is sophisticated, and the modern decor of the room and bathroom is tranquil and soothing. We slept so very well in the comfortable and roomy bed. For the price, this is a perfect hotel. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Convenient Stay”
Reviews.Author: D1j0
Reviews.Content: Took a lot of search to find a clean good hotel to stay for a day in Montreal on short notice. Among all the over-priced options, Novotel was offered a great value. The property is very clean and well kept up. The room was spacious and clean. Good bed. Very good internet access. Not too far from the center Montreal either. Overall we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel but nothing around and airport is 15 mins away!”
Reviews.Author: sparklyirisheyes
Reviews.Content: Pros: fantastic food, really great breakfast and dinners some of the best hotel food I've ever had. Lovely spacious executive room with comp mini bar etc Complimentary airport shuttle Cons: hotel is in middle of highway with nothing around! Not as near airport as u might think but this was no issue for me A few Hairs in the bathroom incl in shower which grossed me out but otherwise spotless I would recommend for business for sure as I was well treated but not for a personal visit... I would return if back to montreal on business Thanks to all at novotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SlyP1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, modern and comfortable. We were there for a night on a stop over. For an "airport" hotel it wasn't very close and for the "shuttle" you need to book in advance. The restaurant will do the trick if you just need food but the quality is not great and is over priced. We originally just wanted to order delivery as there was nothing appealing on the menu but after calling numerous places, the hotel is inconveniently located so most places do not deliver there. If you just need a place to rest your head its decent for the price but don't forget to book your shuttle or you will be waiting outside for awhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lesoleil8
Reviews.Content: 2 queen beds/2 nights Check in: quick and friendly Room: very spacious and bright. Loved the bar fridge - essential when traveling with my little ones. Only negative was there is no place to hang bath towels and bathing suits. There is no towel bar in the bathroom - just one hook!? Pool: basic and clean. Towels are available in the pool area. Breakfast buffet: a great variety of hot foods - french toast, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. Nice spread of fresh fruit, cheeses and deli meat. Cereal and baked goods were also available. Service was supreme - my girls each received a stuffed animal from the servers. Highs: free parking and comfy beds Lows: no towel bar Overall I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Ton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before picking up a car and driving to Quebec City. We were travelling with our 2 1/2 year old son. The Pool was a god send; we were able to tire him out sufficiently. We ate in the hotel restaurant and the staff were very helpful. The food was good and reasonably priced. The staffs of the hotel were very helpful and to top it all off there was a few â€˜shuttle busâ€™ to and from the airport! Highly recommended for families looking for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “All that a business traveller needs”
Reviews.Author: jcapritti
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel at least 10 times per year for the past 4 or 5 years. Although it is referred to as the Novotel Montreal Airport, it's actually about a 15-minute cab ride away. So don't let that throw you. I've been meaning to write a review because I have really come to appreciate the staff at this property. No matter how much time lapses between my visits, everyone remembers me and addresses me by name. And, although this is a busy business hotel, they have done a fine job of keeping the decor looking fresh. The rooms are clean and wifi-equipped with good work space. Natural light is abundant thanks to big windows, but there are room-darkening shades if you have the luxury of sleeping in. The bedding is simple and crisp. The room service menu is limited in terms of selection and serving time [hence my 4/5 stars], but the morning breakfast is excellent. The coffee is uncommonly good - and I say that without the qualifier "for a hotel." It's just excellent. And, they serve some of the best breads I've ever had. I really look forward to the breakfast and seeing the two ladies who run the restaurant in the morning. They're so sweet and attentive without being intrusive. They always help me get my day off to a good start. My clients have also held meetings here and the meeting facilities and catering were also quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dbatts
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great I stayed in the Novotel NYC, here the service and the accommodations were a cut above the rest. My only problem was when I was double charged for a simple meal in the hotel restaurant, so check your bill. To the restaurant's credit they agreed to fix the error in 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near airport, advertized shuttle service doesn't exist.”
Reviews.Author: eurobenjy
Reviews.Content: Arrived into the airport at 10pm, called the hotel to find out about the shuttle service, they told me it was too late and I should take a taxi!! Taxi was 25mins and $32, for which I could've stayed somewhere NEAR the airport that was actually nice!! Staff were very used to dealing with complaints about the (lack of) advertized shuttle service. Very rude, offhand, and discourteous throughout my stay. Bathroom had mould on the tiles. Towels were threadbare. Breakfast was rancid and made me throw up about 1.5hrs later.

Reviews.Title: “About 20-30 minutes from Old Montreal, but well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: The_Arden
Reviews.Content: New, clean, and modern. What more can you ask for? I've stayed in many hotels that cost much more than this one and were not nearly as comfortable. What impressed me the most was the comfort and quality of sleep that I experienced. Mind you, I had a room to myself with a king size bed, so maybe that had something to do with it. But after a long day of walking around Montreal, this space was just what I needed at the end of the day to recharge. The room was beautiful with a very modern and functional washroom. My only complaint is that the walls are bit thin and you may hear slamming doors and loud conversations. There were many amenities available that I did not take advantage including a pool, internet corner, television and an xbox so I can't speak to that except to say that everything looked very clean and in good order. Wi-fi was available in the rooms and ran at a good speed. The restaurant was just ok for breakfast. We had the breakfast buffet, but we arrived about 30 minutes to closing. The staff seemed hurried and the crepes ran out. Otherwise, the food was pretty standard. If you're looking for a good value and don't mind the drive to Centre-ville Montreal, check it out. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Montreal Hotel - it's not near the airport!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a member of the Accor club & because it said it was the Airport hotel - well it's a $25 - $30 cab ride from the airport so be warned!! The airport courtesy bus does not go there! However when we arrived the cab fare was worth it - a very good hotel - well uo to the usual standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport and about 20 minutes from downtown Montreal with free shuttle. The service, room, amenities and food were great. It has a small fitness centre but the equipment are all working and maintained well. The pool and hot tub are ok. My rate came with free breakfast and non-alcoholic drinks in my mini-bar. The bed was very comfortable though wished I had more pillows. Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BuckyRottweiler
Reviews.Content: Fairly new property located on the edge of an industrial park. They were full so I ended up in a handicapped room, so can't really comment on most normal rooms. Was not pleased, but understand. They have a pool, but really small. Decent exercise room, but small. Did not eat on the property, so can't comment. Many places are a short drive. If you're there for the airport, and don't have a rental car, your options are limited although they may provide transportation. I do prefer this to other hotels in the area. Prices for better properties are quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balus Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff-very friendly & helpful The room-very clean modern, comfortable but very poor lighting Bathroom- very good, clean & roomy The hotel is one of the furthest hotels away from the airport that still claims to be an airport hotel. As an A-Club Gold card holder with many nights in Accor properties I was disappointed to be told that the only benefit for my loyalty was that I would earn points for my stay. Apparently the desk clerk was aware of the benefits at other properties but politiely informed me that I would see no benefits staying with them. I would not be likely to stay here again as there are many hotels closer to the airport and ones that I also hold status with. I have found the A-club recognition in both the UK & now here in Canada to be non-existant.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep - Park - Fly”
Reviews.Author: Lefty_59
Reviews.Content: This is now my favorite hotel when it comes to SLEEP-PARK-&-FLY. It offers everything you expect from a quality hotel PLUS you have the possibility of parking your car for ONE (1) MONTH. Other hotels charge extra when you're gone for more than 2 weeks. PROS - Large clean rooms with extremely comfortable beds Very friendly staff Free shuttle to airport Free use of computer Pool - (unfortunately, I didn't get to swim in it) CONS - The shuttle service does not stop directly in front of the arrivals

Reviews.Title: “Car Stolen from Parking Lot”
Reviews.Author: Value4Money_Trust
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel was nice, our 6 month old vehicle was stolen from the parking lot. There were no signs warning the guest checking in of the possibility of one's vehicle being stolen from the parking lot. Although the vehicle was in view of the front desk, it was stolen between 10pm and 1am. The hotel took no responsibility even though the hotel knew of prior thefts and did not advise the guest. The hotel gave no reimbursement for the losses suffered but did state the following "give us another opportunity on your next visit to the Montreal Aeroport." If you think about staying here and are parking your vehicle in the lot, ask if your vehicle is safe and if any have been stolen!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a number of times: always a great stay - comfortable well-equipped room; great service;pet friendly; convenient locationto both downtown and airport

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome on a late, rainy night”
Reviews.Author: TripKathy
Reviews.Content: After a late night arrival, I was very pleased to check into the Novotel. It is a very modern facility - but with great attention to comfort and convenience. Staff were welcoming and helpful. The bathroom in particular was spacious and stylish and highly functional. I had purchased a pre-paid package at a very reasonable price that included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was generous and delicious. I continued on my way well rested and well fed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nonbusinesstraveller
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent a night here while visiting Family in Montreal. The first room we checked into smelled strongly of smoke,but when we contacted the front desk we were moved promptly and givin a credit for breakfast. The front desk staff were excellent they even gave us driving direction when leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: pittman_new
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Montreal on the first day of a 2 week vacation in Canada and Maine. Our stay here started our vacation off the right way. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, and in a great location close to the highway and Montreal. My one negative was the lack of automated checkout, but still the check out did not take very long.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there this past weekend. I am...”
Reviews.Author: lella7
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past weekend. I am extremely satisfied. Excellent service; courteous, friendly And helpful staff. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but very nice comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Sandmann00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the long weekend, and didn't have many alternatives since other hotels were fully booked. The hotel and rooms were very clean. The free wifi was very nice. Location was alright, we've stayed in Montreal before and there are definitely some better options. But if you are trying to stay close to the west island, this is probably the best place to stay. The reason we didn't rate this hotel any better is due to the staff, who seemed very harsh. Front desk was average. We had asked them for some dish soap, so that we could wash our baby bottles but the answer was "No we don't have that" Considering there was a restaurant in the hotel, they usually bring a little bit in a small cup. Second night they rant out of towels, which seems odd even with a full house. Either way it was an average stay for us considering there are a ton of places we could have stayed if there was availability that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackiechandc
Reviews.Content: Very modern clean hotel. The look of the room was very "Scandanavian" or "Ikea" in nature with beech maple finish. Decent sized rooms. About 20-30 mins to downtown so a bit of a travel by right by Hwy 40 and near airport for travellers. Decent gym and pool area. Breakfast buffet was actually really good and the crepes were actually some of the best that I've tasted anywhere! Free parking and free internet access was much appreciated:)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kids2cakes
Reviews.Content: The check in was really fast, very pleasant to deal with. Hotel and room was very clean. Would stay there again - everything we needed was there

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: MrMSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night coming from Tremblant, because our flight was very early in the morning. The Hotel had everything and more than we expected rooms very comfortable and clean, the location wasnÂ´t as perfect because it is about 15-20 minutes from the airport, but there is a free shuttle from the hotel at all time. I think these is the best option in the area and definitely not the more expensive near the airport. I would stayed there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business on the West Island”
Reviews.Author: JMD_from_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I spent a week and a half at this hotel for a business trip on the West-Island of Montreal. This well located hotel meant a short commute to Pointe Claire and Saint Laurent (very conveniently situated mid-position between both on the 40 and Henri-Bourassa.) Please note that this hotel would not be a good choice to visit downtown Montreal for sight-seeing given the inevitable traffic and total lack of public transit choices. I booked on the "Accor" website since this provided the best price quote. The rate is a little above what I would have liked to pay for what is basically an airport hotel. Quebec's punitive taxes obviously inflate the costs of staying here. The hotel room is very nice, modern fixtures, bed, WC facilites, European style, etc. The room is very clean. The rate I paid included a buffet breakfast. Normally I wouldn't even bother with a buffet but this was quite good with an adequate selection of fresh fruit. (And plenty of other "less healthy" food, like croissants and "les viennoiseries" of course.) WiFi Internet is included without extra charge. (Very commendable for this hotel to provide. Many are sneaking in $10-20 / day surcharges for internet.) Parking is free and very abundant on the hotel site. (The website really should mention this.) There is a minuscule sports centre on site (open 24 hours) and a pool no longer than about 10 meters. There is a YMCA nearby on St Jean street so little need to use the hotel facilities. Given however that this is classified as a 4 star establishment, I have some reservations applicable perhaps for someone here for an extended stay. The TV is a widescreen LCD, but they disabled the control to squeeze a 4:3 image into the screen. Telephones are available although an extra charge is added (but these days anyone staying here almost certainly has a cell phone). There are very small refrigerators provided (I suspect with the intent to provide a mini bar service). A small microwave was proved when I asked. Overall this is a good hotel and fit my needs almost perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Montreal Aeroport Ruined Our Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: campinglover
Reviews.Content: My FiancÃ© and I booked all of our friends and family into the Novotel Montreal Aeroport because we found it to be relatively clean and modern looking. The problems began while negotiating the group rate. The staff refuses to return calls or provide follow up. This was of course our first warning sign but we were already committed to the venue. The experience continued while organizing the Rehearsal Cocktail party. After many cheeky emails from the hotel staff, we finally had to schedule a meeting with the hotel management in order to get a reply to our queries. The final straw came the day after our wedding. We realized that while frantically packing our things for the honeymoon and rushing to check out on our way to the wedding, we forgot a full (still wax sealed) 1.75L/60 oz bottle of Knob Creek in our room. When we returned the next day, the front staff said that the room had not been cleaned yet so he would follow up. He then proceeded to compliment me on my great taste in Bourbon. It has now been over a month and no sign of the whiskey or of a credit! In keeping with the trend, the hotel staff refuses to even reply to my emails. Whether it was disposed of by housekeeping or stolen by the staff, I don't care. We only wanted to have this resolved amicably because I do enjoy the Accor chain of hotels. Please do not stay at this hotel if you value your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...networking made easy in a modern environment”
Reviews.Author: PamelaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Overall our company has been using Novotel Techno Park for the past year, and what a great choice! The Hotel is clean, sleek, and very welcoming. Often spend time using the facilities , but mostly able to enjoy the compfort of the TRIO restaurant Launge. Wireless internet available so we are able to do business while eat from the menu in the lounge. Francois the bar tender and the morning staff are truley a delight! Thank you for making my business stay a stay that allows me to get out of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Snufflenox
Reviews.Content: I've passed in front of this hotel many times but never saw it before!! It's location (at the junction of highways 13/40) is good for business travelers but it is Â± 20 - 25 minutes from downtown. It's right next to the landing strip of Dorval Airport but the terminal is on the other side so Â± 15 minutes door to door. Rooms are clean, fitness center is good... Booked the hotel through Hotwire, GREAT value! Would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - a little far from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatus1
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night, as I was flying through Montreal. The hotel was very clean and contemporary. Everything was very modern and comfortable. I had a simple room-service dinner with no problems. In-room Internet worked well and was included. Front desk staff were helpful. The only small complaint is that I was expecting the hotel to be right next to the airport and it was actually a 10-15 minute drive. The shuttle works during regular hours, but for my early morning flight, I had to arrange a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, but No Shuttle to Airport before Six AM”
Reviews.Author: danforp
Reviews.Content: Had a flight cancelled and needed a place to stay for the night before catching an early morning flight at 630am. Booked this hotel using American Express. I was told it had great rooms and service and a shuttle to the airport. The location is about 15 minutes from the airport, so it's not that close. Shuttle picked us up after a 20 min. wait, and we arrived at the hotel. Very nice interiors, and great room for the price. But when I called to book my morning shuttle I was told, oh, i'm sorry the shuttle starts at 6am, much to late for a 630am flight. The only option was to get a taxi at a cost of 25$ for the 15 ride. I love the room, but an airport hotel needs a shuttle service that gets people to the airport for early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller_TO_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel overnight during a drive from T.O. to Quebec City. It's located right along the highway, not far from the airport. The hotel itself is new, very recently built. The decor is ultra-cool and modern. The room was beautiful, immaculately clean, super comfortable beds. I didn't expect much, just needed a clean place to crash without going very far off the highway. The wireless internet was complimentary. This hotel was fantastic! We liked it so much we even considered for 5 seconds cancelling our Quebec City plans and spending the rest of the trip in this hotel. :) Too bad we didn't have time to visit the pool and the hot tub. What a pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Very Modern!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! It is a bit tricky to get to, but it's well worth the time you spend trying to find it. It's about a 10-15 minute drive to downtown Montreal. It's very modern, clean, and the service was great! There's a fitness centre, a pool and a restaurant on site. The bed was amazing and the flat screen television added more space to the room. I fully recommend this anyone wanting accommodations in the Montreal area.

Reviews.Title: “best bang for your buck!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hockeycanada25
Reviews.Content: what can i say ....staff was very helpfull....trouble free weekend in a very clean and up to date room....we stayed here for 85cdn a night ..i dont think any other hotel can come close to this one unless you are in the 150$$ a night rate.... pool is very small....but hey i didnt come for the pool..... the 26inch flat screen is very nice ....but hard to see when your watching in bed.....should of been at least 32" in all rooms.... i would and i am going to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a stop-over.”
Reviews.Author: 2monkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Montreal Aeroport for one night on Oct. 5 in order to catch an early morning flight out of Montreal the following morning. We thought the hotel was very nice and modern looking. Our room had a king bed, plasma tv on the wall ,a fridge and a beautiful bathroom with french doors. We used the hot tub, and pool facilities. The entire area was very clean and organized.The service was excellent. I would highly recomment this hotel for stop-overs or a nice week-end away at an affordable price. We paid $89.00 for the night and for that we got our room, parking for a week and a free shuttle to and from the airport. How do you beat that.? It would have costed us $60.00 just to park at the airport for the week if we had of chosen to just drive down. I will definitely take advantage of this beautiful hotel if need be in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A find at Montreal's Trudeau Airport”
Reviews.Author: crispy05
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at this hotel, but I have nothing but good things to say about it. The decor is sleek modern, yet very comfortable. Our room gave us a view of the city center, and Mt. Royal. The bed linens were crisp, and inviting. The bathroom featured a glass enclosed, large shower (no tub to climb in and out of!) and a porcelain vessel-style sink, plenty of towels The room and bath were very clean, featured a mini-bar, coffeemaker, iron and ironing board, and a flat-screen television mounted on the wall. We had the buffet breakfast, ($13.95 CDN) which featured a whole section devoted to pastries, croissants, and several different kinds of breads to slice yourself. The usual bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, hash browns, were accompanied by french toast, cold meats, cheese, fresh fruit, yoghurt, and five or six choices of cereal. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating, helping us to connect with people who were looking for tickets to the Presidents Cup (golf tournament), as we had extras we weren't using. Even though it's right by the airport and a busy highway, it was QUIET!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: widus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed for one night there recently. The hotel is modern and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. They came to pick us up at the airport within 15min after we called them, and drove us back the next morning as soon as we checked out. The bed was very comfy, and the room was quiet.... I would definitely stay there again if I needed a hotel close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: WaterlooTraveller
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel, especially for the price we paid. Hotel is very new. Everything is clean and ver modern. Rooms have nice big plasma TVs. Washrooms are clean nicely maintained. Beds were very comfortable. Location is accessible from main highway. Within 5 minutes drive, there is huge plaza which have most of the joints like Quiznos, subway, tim hortons and some nice family restaurants. Downside is just a very tiny swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels around!”
Reviews.Author: cal_dude7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently drove to Montreal for a weekend away. We were looking for reasonably priced hotels downtown to stay at for two nights, and couldn't find anything affordable. Turns out that weekend was Quebec's provincial holiday, St. Jean Baptist day, and I guess most of the downtown hotels decided to raise 2their rates. So we ended up staying at an airport outside the city with little expectations at around C$80.00 per night, but were we pleasently suprised! We ended up at the Novotel Airport, a hotel that has not even been around for a year. It was very conveniently located off the highway towards downtown (though the street signs in Montreal made it a lot harder to navigate). Once we arrived inside the main lobby looked very modern and upscale. We were greeted by the front desk clerks, one being Russell, who was very helpful and even provided a container to put flowers in for my girlfriend. The room itself was just as impressive and modernly styled as the lobby. We had a king sized room which included a plasma screen TV as well as an office desk and chair, a very comfortable lounge chair, and various dressers. The bathroom was just as impressive with a huge glass doored shower as well as a modern styled sink. Little extras in the room included a alarm clock with the ability to hook up to an mp3 player/ipod to it, a mini fridge as well as special night lights built into the headboard of the bed which could be turned on and of via touch sensor buttons on the nightstands on each side of the bed. The room itself was very clean, and the windows were huge, offering much chance for sunlight to brighten the room. Aside from the room the restaurant seemed very nice. We had breakfast the first morning there and had delicious crepes. They also had a pool and hot tub which we used both nights we were there. The pool itself was a bit shallow, meant for a lap pool I guess, but the hot tub was amazing! There was also a gym facility with a decent array of machines as well as two plasma TV's. The location of the hotel wasn't so bad either. Only a 10 minute drive to the nearest park and ride for Montreal's metro (subway station), we had access to all of downtown from it. So if you want to experience Montreal in luxury without shelling out tons of cash to do it, I would highly recommend this hotel as it has tons to offer!
